Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp with a central tube, a beaded rim and a long tapering nozzle. Decorated with a red slip. Pink fabric with common fine mica and sparse <0.5mm white inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr Ernest Arthur Gardner
Curator's comments: Parallel from Athens (Howland 1958, Type 12A). Parallels from Sardis (end of the 6th century BC and before a 499 BC destruction layer) and Megara Hyblaea (Bailey 1977, 95). See British Museum GR 1971,1224.9 also from Naukratis. Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals. Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q150)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.01) (Phase 1)
